quote: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
author: John Lennon

quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set him free.
author: Michelangelo

quote: You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
author: Robin Williams

quote: If you want a vision of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face - forever.
author: George Orwell

quote: If you can imagine it, you can achieve it. If you can dream it, you can become it.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The man who has no imagination has no wings.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: Men are mortal. So are ideas. An idea needs propagation as much as a plant needs watering. Otherwise both will wither and die.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Imagination creates reality.
author: Richard Wagner

quote: Visualize this thing that you want, see it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blue print, and begin to build.
author: Robert Collier

quote: There are no rules of architecture for a castle in the clouds.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: They who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Imagination rules the world.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: You can't do it unless you can imagine it.
author: George Lucas

quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
author: Walt Disney

quote: True originality consists not in a new manner but in a new vision.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Those who do not want to imitate anything, produce nothing.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: A man may imagine things that are false, but he can only understand things that are true, for if the things be false, the apprehension of them is not understanding.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The visionary starts with a clean sheet of paper, and re-imagines the world.
author: Malcolm Gladwell

quote: An idea is salvation by imagination.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: What we wish, we readily believe, and what we ourselves think, we imagine others think also.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Some stories are true that never happened.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: To accomplish great things we must first dream, then visualize, then plan... believe... act!
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: Imagine for yourself a character, a model personality, whose example you determine to follow, in private as well as in public.
author: Epictetus

quote: Imagination and fiction make up more than three quarters of our real life.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The world is governed by very different personages from what is imagined by those who are not behind the scenes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
author: Richard Bach

quote: The saddest thing I can imagine is to get used to luxury.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: The lunatic, the lover, and the poet, are of imagination all compact.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
author: Duane Michals

quote: Vision is the true creative rhythm.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can't be done. 2) It probably can be done, but it's not worth doing. 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: The artist must bow to the monster of his own imagination.
author: Richard Wright

quote: When you can imagine you begin to create and when you begin to create you realize that you can create a world that you prefer to live in, rather than a world that you're suffering in.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Ideas control the world.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Solitude is as needful to the imagination as society is wholesome for the character.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: All successful people men and women are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: I imagine that yes is the only living thing.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: One can live in the shadow of an idea without grasping it.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: You have many years ahead of you to create the dreams that we can't even imagine dreaming. You have done more for the collective unconscious of this planet than you will ever know.
author: Steven Spielberg

quote: The only sure weapon against bad ideas is better ideas.
author: Alfred Whitney Griswold

quote: Imagination is the voice of daring. If there is anything Godlike about God it is that. He dared to imagine everything.
author: Henry Miller

quote: People who lean on logic and philosophy and rational exposition end by starving the best part of the mind.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Imagine what a harmonious world it could be if every single person, both young and old shared a little of what he is good at doing.
author: Quincy Jones

quote: We imagine that we want to escape our selfish and commonplace existence, but we cling desperately to our chains.
author: Anne Sullivan

quote: Learn to see things as they really are, not as we imagine they are.
author: Vernon Howard
